albumDescription: Rare is the fourth studio album by American singer Selena Gomez. It was released on January 10, 2020, through Interscope Records. Gomez began working on the album in 2018, after taking a break from music following the release of her third studio album, Revival (2015). She collaborated with a number of songwriters and producers, including Justin Tranter, Julia Michaels, Ian Kirkpatrick, Kid Harpoon, and Mattman & Robin. The album was preceded by the release of the lead single, "Lose You to Love Me", on October 23, 2019. Gomez described the album as "a celebration of love in all its forms". The album was supported by the singles "Look at Her Now", "Rare", "Boyfriend", "Fun", "Crowded Room", and "Souvenir". Gomez promoted the album with a world tour, which began in March 2020 and was postponed due to the COVID-19 pandemic. The album debuted at number one on the US Billboard 200, with first-week sales of 108,000 album-equivalent units, of which 100,000 were pure album sales. It also debuted at number one in Australia, Canada, Ireland, New Zealand, and the United Kingdom. The album received generally positive reviews from music critics, who praised its production and Gomez's vocal performance. It was nominated for Best Pop Vocal Album at the 63rd Annual Grammy Awards.

Rare deluxe is the fourth studio album by American singer Selena Gomez. It was released on January 10, 2020, through Interscope Records. Gomez began working on the album in 2018, after taking a break from music following the release of her third studio album, Revival (2015). She collaborated with a number of songwriters and producers, including Justin Tranter, Julia Michaels, Ian Kirkpatrick, Kid Harpoon, and Mattman & Robin. The album was preceded by the release of the lead single, "Lose You to Love Me", on October 23, 2019. Gomez described the album as "a celebration of love in all its forms". The album was supported by the singles "Look at Her Now", "Rare", "Boyfriend", "Fun", "Crowded Room", and "Souvenir". Gomez promoted the album with a world tour, which began in March 2020 and was postponed due to the COVID-19 pandemic. The album debuted at number one on the US Billboard 200, with first-week sales of 108,000 album-equivalent units, of which 100,000 were pure album sales. It also debuted at number one in Australia, Canada, Ireland, New Zealand, and the United Kingdom. The album received generally positive reviews from music critics, who praised its production and Gomez's vocal performance. It was nominated for Best Pop Vocal Album at the 63rd Annual Grammy Awards.

Revival is the third studio album by American singer Selena Gomez. It was released on October 9, 2015, by Interscope Records. Gomez began working on the album in 2013, after the release of her second studio album, Stars Dance (2013). She collaborated with a number of songwriters and producers, including Justin Tranter, Julia Michaels, Ian Kirkpatrick, Kid Harpoon, and Mattman & Robin. The album was preceded by the release of the lead single, "Good for You", on July 10, 2015. Gomez described the album as "a celebration of life". The album was supported by the singles "Same Old Love", "Hands to Myself", "Kill Em with Kindness", and "Camouflage". Gomez promoted the album with a world tour, which began in March 2016 and was postponed due to the COVID-19 pandemic. The album debuted at number one on the US Billboard 200, with first-week sales of 108,000 album-equivalent units, of which 100,000 were pure album sales. It also debuted at number one in Australia, Canada, Ireland, New Zealand, and the United Kingdom. The album received generally positive reviews from music critics, who praised its production and Gomez's vocal performance. It was nominated for Best Pop Vocal Album at the 63rd Annual Grammy Awards.

Stars Dance is the second studio album by American singer Selena Gomez. It was released on July 23, 2013, by Hollywood Records. Gomez began working on the album in 2012, after the release of her debut studio album, Kiss & Tell (2011). She collaborated with a number of songwriters and producers, including Justin Tranter, Julia Michaels, Ian Kirkpatrick, Kid Harpoon, and Mattman & Robin. The album was preceded by the release of the lead single, "Come & Get It", on May 3, 2013. Gomez described the album as "a celebration of life". The album was supported by the singles "Slow Down", "Naturally", "Love You Like a Love Song", and "The Heart Wants What It Wants". Gomez promoted the album with a world tour, which began in March 2014 and was postponed due to the COVID-19 pandemic. The album debuted at number one on the US Billboard 200, with first-week sales of 108,000 album-equivalent units, of which 100,000 were pure album sales. It also debuted at number one in Australia, Canada, Ireland, New Zealand, and the United Kingdom. The album received generally positive reviews from music critics, who praised its production and Gomez's vocal performance. It was nominated for Best Pop Vocal Album at the 63rd Annual Grammy Awards.

When the Sun Goes Down is the debut studio album by American pop rock band Selena Gomez & the Scene. It was released on June 29, 2010, by Hollywood Records. Gomez began working on the album in 2009, after the release of her debut solo EP, Kiss & Tell (2011). She collaborated with a number of songwriters and producers, including Justin Tranter, Julia Michaels, Ian Kirkpatrick, Kid Harpoon, and Mattman & Robin. The album was preceded by the release of the lead single, "Naturally", on May 3, 2013. Gomez described the album as "a celebration of life". The album was supported by the singles "Slow Down", "Naturally", "Love You Like a Love Song", and "The Heart Wants What It Wants". Gomez promoted the album with a world tour, which began in March 2014 and was postponed due to the COVID-19 pandemic. The album debuted at number one on the US Billboard 200, with first-week sales of 108,000 album-equivalent units, of which 100,000 were pure album sales. It also debuted at number one in Australia, Canada, Ireland, New Zealand, and the United Kingdom. The album received generally positive reviews from music critics, who praised its production and Gomez's vocal performance. It was nominated for Best Pop Vocal Album at the 63rd Annual Grammy Awards.
